ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I expanded on my ASL skills and learned more about the Deaf community/culture.
I developed a deeper understanding of ASL and Deaf Culture.
I learned new vocabulary, grammar, and Deaf culture concepts that extended from ASL 1. There were opportunities to sign in conversations.
I furthered my knowledge of ASL and Deaf culture and community.
I greatly improved my knowledge of both ASL and Deaf Culture. In particular, this course is a good way to practice comprehension.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: It was great, this course couldnt be improved anymore.

This course has so many strengths. Since we learn the vocabulary on our own, all class time is spent doing activities for practice. Class time is very flexible as well, so whether it's grammar practice we need, vocab practice, of if we need to go over homework, Dr. K was very accommodating and informative.
Dr. K is very understanding of students and very accommodating. Classes were also very interactive and very educational. It never felt like a class I dreaded attending; it was always super fun!
This is one of my all-time favorite courses I've taken here at Yale. Dr. K is the best!
The class was fantastic! I loved the emphasis on group work and conversation as well as the clear expectations laid out for us.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The virtual format was the best given the pandemic and the mannerisms of ASL.
Everything was successful. Dr. K has previous experience teaching virtually, so everything ran smoothly most of the time except for technical difficulties.
The performance quizzes and assignments worked very well during the pandemic, as well as the small class size to allow for more conversations through Zoom.

Dr. K did a wonderful job of catering to our needs during this tough time -- she provided weekly virtual office hours/conversation practice, and was very kind and understanding when it came to any COVID-related problems (or anything in general!).

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Yes, Dr. K is an absolute gem and anyone who
is lucky enough to have her as an instructor should jump at the opportunity. She makes class very welcoming and always makes sure that students have what they need to succeed.
Yes. definitely. Dr. K is amazing and ASL is an enthralling language.
Definitely! It's such a fun and useful class, and a great way to learn about Deaf culture.

Absolutely! ASL is a super cool and unique language, and learning about Deaf culture is really interesting. Dr. K makes every class something to look forward to, and the class is very low stress, which allows for a wonderful learning experience.
Yes absolutely. Dr. K is phenomenal and the course is both effective and a blast. I loved the people and the content!

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Pre-class study content was recorded to help us better prepare for live lectures
none
None
